  • Field Details

    • players

      private final Map<String,Player> players
      Players that are playing in this game (map of playerId -> Player)

    • commonGoals

      private final List<CommonGoal> commonGoals
      Common goals associated to this game (list of CommonGoal)

    • livingRoom

      private final LivingRoom livingRoom
      Living room associated to this game

    • playerTurnQueue

      private final List<String> playerTurnQueue
      Round player turn sequence of the game

      It is used as a "circular queue", every time turn is given to the next player the Player on the bottom of the list (element 0) is put on the top of the list (last element)

      Top Player of the list (last element) is assumed to be the player that currently has the turn

    • availablePlayers

      private final List<Player> availablePlayers
      List of player objects that aren't associated with a connected player

      It is used as available player on Matchmaking and as list of disconnected player when a player exit game during Gameplay

    • firstPlayer

      private String firstPlayer
      First player that ever had the turn, it is assumed to be also the first player of every round

    • lastTurn

      private boolean lastTurn
      Signal of last round of turns

    • status

      private Game.GameStatus status
      Current status of the game

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(String playerId) throws PlayerAlreadyExistsException, MatchmakingClosedException
      This method adds a new Player to game, the new Player is referenced by playerId. After this method has been invoked with success the same Player can be obtained via getPlayer(playerId)
      Specified by:
      addPlayer in class Game
      Parameters:
      playerId - the new id that has to be associated to the new Player
      Throws:
      PlayerAlreadyExistsException - if players key-set already contains playerId
      MatchmakingClosedException - if status is not matchmaking

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String playerId) throws PlayerNotExistsException
      This method removes a Player from the game, the Player is referenced by playerId. After this method has been invoked with success then getPlayer(playerId) will throw PlayerNotExistsException
      Specified by:
      removePlayer in class Game
      Parameters:
      playerId - the id of the player that needs to be removed
      Throws:
      PlayerNotExistsException - when no player is associated with playerId

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(String playerId) throws PlayerNotExistsException
      This method returns the Player associated to the playerId
      Specified by:
      getPlayer in class Game
      Parameters:
      playerId - the id of the Player requested
      Returns:
      Player of players associated to playerId
      Throws:
      PlayerNotExistsException - if players key-set does not contain playerId

    • setLastTurn

      public void setLastTurn()
      This method marks the current turn sequence to be the last one.

      If invoked then isLastTurn method will return true

      Set lastTurn true

      Specified by:
      setLastTurn in class Game

      Parameters:
      personalGoals - list of all personal goals
      Returns:
      the amount of points earned by personal goals

    • getCommonGoalPoints

      private int getCommonGoalPoints(List<Token> tokens)
      This method returns an amount of points equivalent to the sum of provided tokens
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the amount of points equivalent to the sum of provided tokens

    • getShelfTilesGroupsPoints

      private int getShelfTilesGroupsPoints(Tile[][] shelf)
      This method returns an amount of points based on evaluation of how many and how big are groups of tiles in a shelf
      Parameters:
      shelf - the shelf to be evaluated
      Returns:
      the amount of points the shelf is worth

    • depthSearch

      private int depthSearch(int i, int j, Tile[][] shelf, boolean[][] checked, String tileColor)
      This function provides support for getShelfTilesGroupPoints() and provide a recursive depth search on tile groups
      Parameters:
      i - row index
      j - column index
      shelf - the shelf to be evaluated
      checked - the matrix of checked tiles
      tileColor - the color of the tile group
      Returns:
      the size of the tile group
